newsitem.title: UK: Colombia plans to sell natural gas transport firm.
newsitem.headline: Colombia plans to sell natural gas transport firm.

text.p: Colombia plans to spin off its natural gas transportation network from state-run Ecopetrol and sell it as part of a major privatisation drive, the Minister of Mines and Energy said on Monday.

"We want to take all the transporation assets out of Ecopetrol in the gas sector and form a new company. We hope to do it by end of this year or early next year," Rodrigo Villamizar told Reuters in an interview here.
"Ecopetrol will continue to be a producer of both oil and gas." The gas transport company would be called Ecogas.
Villamizar also said he plans to separate production and transporation in the world's largest open-pit coal mine El Cerrejon, and float them off as separate companies.

"We want a separate company to run the transporation business," he said, adding he had already received interest from RTZ, Gencore, BHP, Drummond and Exxon. The mine is currently owned 50-50 by Colombia and Exxon Corp.
